definition: conflict/internal strife/dissension
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
surname Ya
to crush together (in a crowd)/to make friends/to check (accounts)
to crush/to knock sb down with a vehicle
to roll (steel)

sentences.english: Firms are also suing each other.
sentences.chinese: 同时，各公司也在互相倾轧。

sentences.english: Hope for United States aid played a great part in the jockeying between contending factions.
sentences.chinese: 争取获得美援的希望，大大促进了各派系的相互倾轧。

sentences.english: The forces of unreason destroy one another in futile strife.
sentences.chinese: 而那些非理性的力量则在无益的倾轧中互相毁灭。

sentences.english: It has, rightly, reported on the crushing of protests and internet censorship.
sentences.chinese: 它公正地报道了抗议示威与网上审查间的相互倾轧。

sentences.english: Jostling against one another under the domination of desires, who will think of lenient hoary mother?
sentences.chinese: 在欲望的支配下彼此倾轧，有谁想到仁爱年老的母亲？

definition: scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
to fight and scheme against each other (idiom)/(in palace construction) elaborate and refined
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
variant of 勾心鬥角|勾心斗角[gou1 xin1 dou4 jiao3]
power struggle
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
struggle/war
internal power struggle
to dispute
to be narrowly partisan/to unite with those of the same views but alienate those with different views
internecine strife (idiom); fighting among oneself
to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
clique
to attack sb by exposing faults/to denounce
